info.game_comments:
2004 Teen Tournament final game 2.

(Sarah: From the studios of MTV's TRL, we're bringing you TRJ--Total Request Jeopardy!--coming up next!)

(1, 1).clue: In December 1993 Toni Morrison became the first African-American woman awarded this international literature prize

(2, 1).clue: (Sarah leads us off from the studios of MTV's TRL.)  She said of her hit, "So Yesterday", "When I heard it for the first time on the radio, I was freaking out""So yesterday, so yesterday; I'm just a bird that's already..."

(3, 1).clue: This mythic strongman gets the fifth-largest constellation

(4, 1).clue: Gum stuck to your shirt? Stick the shirt in this to harden the gum, then use a credit card to scrape it off

(5, 1).clue: With an annual salary of $179,000, this state's George Pataki is the USA's highest-paid governor

(6, 1).clue: This word comes before duchy, canyon & slam

(1, 2).clue: In October 1967 Thurgood Marshall was sworn in as the first African-American one of these

(2, 2).clue: (Sarah continues our tour down TRL memory lane.) This colorful artist's video, "Trouble", was shot on the same location as "Little House on the Prairie". Check it out..."In my own town; I'm trouble, yeah, trouble now..."

(3, 2).clue: Pictor is this, a painter's stand

(4, 2).clue: Get decorative by gluing stray buttons on these items that hold things to your bulletin board

(5, 2).clue: 2 years after his brother was elected President, this senator from Massachusetts took office

(6, 2).clue: Of a person who bowls, a small barrel or a noodle dish, what a kegler does

(1, 3).clue: W.E.B. Du Bois was the first African-American to earn a doctorate from this prestigious Massachusetts university

(2, 3).clue: (Sarah takes us on another stop on TRL Street.) Our Christina Aguilera video is a track on this 2002 CD, also the name of her world tour:"I am beautiful; no matter what they say..."

(3, 3).clue: Sagittarius is the archer; Sagitta is this

(4, 3).clue: Brewed bags of the chamomile type of this can soothe skin that's been irritated by the sun, but cool them first

(5, 3).clue: In 2000 this current Speaker of the House was inducted into the National Wrestling Hall of Fame

(6, 3).clue: It sounds like an illness, but it's the pipe through which smoke passes in a chimney

(1, 4).clue: In 1977 Andrew Young became the first African-American to serve as U.S. ambassador to this body

(2, 4).clue: (We now return you to Sarah in the TRL studios in New York.) Once a backup singer for the likes of Faith Evans and Puff Daddy, she's hit 'em up good ever since. Take a look... "From the crib to the ride and the clothes; so you better let him know..."

(4, 4).clue: The cider type of this salad dressing ingredient is a perfect addition to a soothing bath

(5, 4).clue: This former Democratic running mate announced his candidacy for Presidency on January 13, 2003

(6, 4).clue: It can mean disgusting, or 12 dozen

(1, 5).clue: In 1978 this escaped slave became the first African-American woman honored on a U.S. postage stamp

(2, 5).clue: (Sarah wraps things up from New York and TRL.) This next band got its name from a character in an "X-Files" episode:"Think twice before you touch my girl; come around, come around no more..."

(3, 5).clue: Virgo is a maiden; Monoceros is this mythical beast that represents maidenhood

(4, 5).clue: Hey, pet owners; this clay-based product can help soak up grease spots in the garage

(5, 5).clue: This West Virginian, who's been in the Senate since 1959, was President Pro Tempore of the Senate twice

(6, 5).clue: Containing all 5 vowels, this 8-letter word means a feeling of well-being or elation

(1, 1).clue: This particle adds to the mass of an atom, but not to the charge

(2, 1).clue: In chapter 3 of this novel, Jo thinks Laurie is going off to college, then finds out that he's only 15

(4, 1).clue: The Golden Spike historic site in this state commemorates the completion of the first transcontinental railroad

(5, 1).clue: This 1803 territorial acquisition from France doubled the area of the United States

(6, 1).clue: In a rhyming phrase, it means to move with the prevailing trend

(1, 2).clue: Milk of magnesia has a value of about 10.5 on this scale, making it a base

(2, 2).clue: Chapter VI of this novel introduces us to shy 17-year old Melanie, who's in love with Ashley Wilkes

(3, 2).clue: By definition, something 3-dimensional has width, height, & this

(4, 2).clue: This island that was home to a notorious prison is part of the Golden Gate National Recreation Area in San Francisco

(5, 2).clue: On July 24, 1847 this Mormon leader & his party of 143 reached the Great Salt Lake Valley

(6, 2).clue: Make more effort than required, like by walking 1,760 more yards

(1, 3).clue: Term for a substance that causes or accelerates a chemical reaction without itself being affected

(2, 3).clue: "This Vast Land" is the fictional diary of 19-year old George Shannon, a real member of this duo's corps of discovery

(3, 3).clue: This company's name is short of Integrated Electronics

(4, 3).clue: This D.C. national historic site is the only one that's also an active theater

(5, 3).clue: On October 22, 1819 the first boat travelled on this canal, from Rome to Utica, New York

(6, 3).clue: To expire like a bankrupt business or a dead fish

(1, 4).clue: Usually, in a liquid solution, the less abundant substance is called the solute & the more abundant, this

(2, 4).clue: In a novel by Oscar Wilde, teenage actress Sibyl Vane falls for this man, the subject of a strange portrait

(3, 4).clue: In Thailand 95 percent of the people are of this religion

(4, 4).clue: Commemorating a 1965 civil rights march is the Selma to this city National Historic Trail in Alabama

(5, 4).clue: At noon on April 22, 1889 settlers rushed to claim land in this new territory: many entered "sooner" than noon

(6, 4).clue: A synonym for "get lost"; you might tell Ben Franklin to do it

(2, 5).clue: Rusty-James, whose brother is Motorcycle Boy, is the troubled hero of this teen classic by S.E. Hinton

(3, 5).clue: In mythology he's Neptune's Greek equivalent

(4, 5).clue: This state's only national memorial honors clergyman Roger Williams

(5, 5).clue: The 1890 Battle of Wounded Knee in this state was the last major conflict between Indians & U.S. troops

(6, 5).clue: In a wrestling metaphor, to fight fiercely

(0, 0).clue: This small town in Tuscany was the birthplace of the man who painted the Mona Lisa
